00048 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00049 
00050 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00051 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00052 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00053 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00054 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00055 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00056 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00057 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00058 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00059 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00061 typedef struct {
00062 
00063     volatile unsigned long lock;
00064 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00065     const char *file;
00066     const char *function;
00067     unsigned line;
00068     int cpu;
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00070 } xnlock_t;
00071 
00072 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00073 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00074 #else
00075 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00076         0,                                      \
00077         NULL,                                   \
00078         0,                                      \
00079         -1                                      \
00080         }
00081 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00082 
00083 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00084 
00085 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00086 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00087 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00088 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00089     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00090 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00100 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00101 
00102 static inline spl_t
00103 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00104 {
00105     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00106 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00107 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00108 {
00109 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00110     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00111     unsigned long flags;
00112 
00113     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00114 
00115     adeos_load_cpuid();
00116 
00117     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00118         {
00119         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00120             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00121                bit_spin_lock. */
00122             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00123                 {
00124                 cpu_relax();
00125 
00126 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00127                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00128                     {
00129                     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00130                     printk(KERN_ERR
00131                            "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00132                            "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00133                            "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00134                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00135                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00136                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00137                     for (;;)
00138                         safe_halt();
00139                     }
00140 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00141                 }
00142 
00143 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00144         lock->file = file;
00145         lock->function = function;
00146         lock->line = line;
00147         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00148 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00149         }
00150     else
00151         flags |= 2;
00152 
00153     return flags;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00157 
00158 {
00159     if (!(flags & 2))
00160         {
00161         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00162 
00163         rthal_cli();
00164 
00165         adeos_load_cpuid();
00166 
00167         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00168             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00169         }
00170 
00171     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00172 }
00173 
00174 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00175 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00176 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00177 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00178 
00179 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00180 
00181 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00182 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00183 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00184 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00185 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00186 
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00189 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS

00191 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00192 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00193 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00194 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00195    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00196    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00197    timer interrupt instead. */
00198 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00199 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00200 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00201 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00249 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00250 
00251     /* Kernel mode side */
00252     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00253     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00254     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00255     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00256     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00257 
00258     /* User mode side */
00259     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00260     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00261 
00262     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00263     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00264     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00265 
00266 } xnarchtcb_t;
00267

00296 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00297     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00298 }
00299 
00300 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00301     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00302 }
00303 
00304 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00305     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00309     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00310 }
00311 
00312 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00313     return adeos_processor_id();
00314 }
00315 
00316 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00317 
00318 {
00319     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00320         return vmalloc(bytes);
00321 
00322     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00323 }
00324 
00325 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00326 
00327 {
00328     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00329         vfree(chunk);
00330     else
00331         kfree(chunk);
00332 }

00336 #define xnarch_put_cpu(flags) adeos_put_cpu(flags)

00338 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00339 do { \
00340     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00341     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00342     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00343     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00344 } while(0)

00347 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00349 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00350 
00351 {
00352     spl_t s;
00353     splhigh(s);
00354     splexit(!!imask);
00355     return !!s;
00356 }

00360 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00361                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00362                                                    void *cookie),
00363                                    void *cookie)
00364 {
00365     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00366 
00367     if (!err)
00368         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00369 
00370     return err;
00371 }
00372 
00373 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00374 
00375     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00376 }
00377 
00378 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00379 
00380 {
00381     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00382         return -EINVAL;
00383 
00384     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00385 
00386     return 0;
00387 }
00388 
00389 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00390 
00391 {
00392     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00393         return -EINVAL;
00394 
00395     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00396 
00397     return 0;
00398 }

00405     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00406 }

00408 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00409 
00410     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);

00430 
00431 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00432 
00433 {
00434     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00435 
00436     adeos_load_cpuid();
00437 
00438     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00439        and always inside a critical section. */
00440     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00441     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00442     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00443     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00444     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00445 }
00446 
00447 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00448     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00449 }
00450 
00451 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00452                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00453                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00454                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00455                                     )
00456 {
00457 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00458 
00459     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00460         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00461         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00462         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00463         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00464         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00465         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00466         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00467         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00468         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00469         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00470         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00471         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00472         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00473         "ret\n\t" \
00474 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00475         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00476         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00477       : /* no output */ \
00478       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00479         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00480         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00481         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00482         "b" (out_tcb), \
00483         "S" (in_tcb), \
00484         "a" (outproc), \
00485         "d" (inproc));
00486 
00487 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00488 
00489     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00490     
00491     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00492         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00493         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00494         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00495         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00496         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00497         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00498         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00499         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00500         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00501         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00502         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00503         "ret\n\t" \
00504 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00505       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00506         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00507         "=S" (esi_out), \
00508         "=D" (edi_out), \
00509         "+a" (outproc), \
00510         "+d" (inproc) \
00511       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00512         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00513         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00514         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00515 
00516 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00517 }
00518 
00519 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00520                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00521 {
00522     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00523     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00524 
00525     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00526         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00527            bit need to be cleared. */
00528         clts();
00529     
00530     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00531 
00532     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00533         {
00534         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00535 
00536         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00537 
00538         if (!inproc->mm)
00539             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00540         }
00541 
00542     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00543 
00544     stts();
00545 }
00546 
00547 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00548                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00549     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00553     /* Empty */
00554 }
00555 
00556 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00557                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00558                                          const char *name)
00559 {
00560     tcb->user_task = current;
00561     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00562     tcb->esp = 0;
00563     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00564     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00565     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00566 }
00567 
00568 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00569 
00570     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00571     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00572     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00573     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00574     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00575     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00576 }
00577 
00578 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00579                                                int imask,
00580                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00581                                                void *cookie)
00582 {
00583     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00584     stts();
00585     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00586     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00587     entry(cookie);
00588     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00589 }
00590 
00591 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00592                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00593                                        void *cookie,
00594                                        int imask,
00595                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00596                                        char *name)
00597 {
00598     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00599 
00600     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00601     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00602     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00603     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00604     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00605     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00606     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00607     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00608     *--(*psp) = 0;
00609 }
00610 
00611 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00612 
00613 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00614 
00615 {
00616     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00617        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00618 
00619     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00620 
00621     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00622         {
00623         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00624         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00625         }
00626 }
00627 
00628 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00629 
00630 {
00631     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00632         {
00633         clts();
00634 
00635         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00636             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00637         else
00638             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00639         }
00640 }
00641 
00642 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00643 
00644 {
00645     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00646 
00647     if (task)
00648         {
00649         if (!task->used_math)
00650             {
00651             stts();
00652             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00653             }
00654 
00655         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00656            hardware. */
00657         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00658         }
00659 
00660     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00661        user-space or kernel thread. */
00662 
00663     clts();
00664 
00665     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00666         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00667     else
00668         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00669 }
00670 
00671 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00672 
00673 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00674 
00675 {}
00676 
00677 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00678 
00679 {}
00680 
00681 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00682 
00683 {}
00684 
00685 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00686 
00687 int xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00688 
00689     while (!*flagp)
00690         {
00691 #if !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00692         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00693         schedule_timeout(1);
00694 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG. */
00695         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00696         schedule_timeout(1);
00697         if(signal_pending(current))
00698             return -ERESTARTSYS;
00699 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG. */
00700         }
00701 
00702     return 0;
00703 }
00704 
00705 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP

00707 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00708 
00709     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00710 }
00711 
00712 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00713 
00714 {
00715     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00716                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00717                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00718                                      NULL,
00719                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00720 }
00721 
00722 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00723 
00724 {
00725     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00726                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00727                                      NULL,
00728                                      NULL,
00729                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00730 }
00731 
00732 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00733 
00734 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00735 {
00736     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00737 }
00738 
00739 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00740     
00741 {
00742     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00743     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00744     unsigned long flags;
00745     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00746 
00747     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00748 
00749     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00750        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00751        context. */
00752     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00753                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00754 
00755     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00756     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00757     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00758     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00759 
00760     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00761         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00762     
00763     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00764                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00765 }
00766 
00767 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00768 
00769 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00770 
00771     return 0;
00772 }
00773 
00774 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00775 
00776     return 0;
00777 }
00778 
00779 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00780 
00781     return 0;
00782 }
00783 
00784 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00785 
00786 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00787 
00788 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00789 
00790 {
00791 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00792     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00793        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00794     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00795 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00796 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00797     xnshadow_release_events();
00798 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00799     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00800     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00801     schedule_timeout(50);
00802     xnarch_release_ipi();
00803 }
00804 
00805 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00806 
00807 {
00808     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00809 
00810     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00811         {
00812         spl_t s;
00813         splsync(s);
00814         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00815         splexit(s);
00816         return 1;
00817         }
00818 
00819     return 0;
00820 }
00821 
00822 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00823 
00824 {
00825 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00826     xnshadow_grab_events();
00827 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00828 }
00829 
00830 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00832 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00833 
00834 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00835                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00836                                            const char *name)
00837 {
00838     struct task_struct *task = current;
00839 
00840     tcb->user_task = task;
00841     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00842     tcb->esp = 0;
00843     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00844     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00845     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00846 }
00847 
00848 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00849 
00850 {
00851     unsigned irq;
00852 
00853     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00854         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00855                              handler,
00856                              NULL,
00857                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00858 }
00859 
00860 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00861 
00862 {
00863     unsigned irq;
00864 
00865     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00866         {
00867         switch (irq)
00868             {
00869 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00870             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00871             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00872             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00873             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00874 
00875                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00876                 continue;
00877 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00878 
00879             default:
00880 
00881                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00882             }
00883         }
00884 }
00885 
00886 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00887 
00888 {
00889     unsigned irq;
00890 
00891     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00892         {
00893         switch (irq)
00894             {
00895 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00896             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00897             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00898             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00899             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00900 
00901                 continue;
00902 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00903 
00904             default:
00905 
00906                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00907             }
00908         }
00909 }
00910 
00911 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00913 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00914 
00915 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00916     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00917        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00918        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00919        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00920     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00921 }
00922 
00923 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00924     rthal_release_timer();
00925 }
00926 
00927 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00928 
00929 {
00930 #if CONFIG_SMP
00931     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00932 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00933     return 0;
00934 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00935 }
00936 
00937 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00938                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00939                                         unsigned long long defval)
00940 {
00941 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00942     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00943     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00944     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00945 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00946     *shot = defval;
00947     *delivery = defval;
00948 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00949 }

00951 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00975 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00976 
00977 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00978 
00979 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00980 
00981 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00982 
00983 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00984 
00985 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00986 
00987 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00988 
00989 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00990 
00991 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00992 {
00993     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00994 
00995     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00996     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00997     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00998 
00999     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
01000 }
01001 
01002 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
01003 
01004 {
01005 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
01006     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
01007 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
01008     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
01009        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
01010        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
01011        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
01012        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
01013        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
01014     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
01015 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
01016 }
01017 
01018 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
01019 
01020 {
01021     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
01022 
01023     if (!nktimerlat)
01024         return -ENODEV;
01025 
01026     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
01027 
01028     return 0;
01029 }
01030 
01031 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
01032 
01033 {
01034     int err = 0;
01035 
01036 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01037     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
01038        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01039     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01040 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01041 
01042     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01043 
01044     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01045         return -ENOSYS;
01046 
01047     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01048                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01049                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01050                               NULL,
01051                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01052 
01053     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01054 
01055 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01056     err = xnshadow_mount();
01057 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01058 
01059     if (err)
01060         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01061     else
01062         err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
01063 
01064     return err;
01065 }
01066 
01067 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01068 
01069 {
01070 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01071     xnshadow_cleanup();
01072 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01073     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01074     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01075 }
01076 
01077 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01078 
01079 #ifdef XENO_TRACES_MODULE
01080 
01081 #include <asm/timex.h>          /* For cpu_khz */
01082 #include <linux/kernel_stat.h>  /* For kstat_irqs */
01083 
01084 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
01085 
01086 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI
01087 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (irq_stat[(cpu)].apic_timer_irqs)
01088 
01089 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01090 
01091 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_8254_IRQ
01092 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01093 
01094 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01095 
01096 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)
01097 
01098 #endif /* XENO_TRACES_MODULE */
